00049 /* Private function prototypes -----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00050 void USB_Configuration(void);
00051 void USBPLL_Configuration(void);
00052 void USBVRG_Configuration(void);
00053 void Suspend(u32 uPara);
00054 
00055 /* Global variables ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00056 __ALIGN4 USBDCore_TypeDef gUSBCore;
00057 USBD_Driver_TypeDef gUSBDriver;
00058 u32 gIsLowPowerAllowed = TRUE;
00059 
00060 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00061 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00062   * @brief  Main program.
00063   * @retval None
00064   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00065 int main(void)
00066 {
00067   RETARGET_Configuration();           /* Retarget Related configuration                                     */
00068 
00069   USB_Configuration();                /* USB Related configuration                                          */
00070 
00071   HT32F_DVB_USBConnect();
00072 
00073   while (1)
00074   {
00075     USBDCore_MainRoutine(&gUSBCore);  /* USB core main routine                                              */
00076   }
00077 }
00078 
00079 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00080   * @brief  Configure USB.
00081   * @retval None
00082   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00083 void USB_Configuration(void)
00084 {
00085   { /* Enable peripheral clock                                                                              */
00086     CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00087     CKCUClock.Bit.USBD = 1;
00088     CKCUClock.Bit.EXTI = 1;
00089     CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00090   }
00091 
00092   #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00093   USBPLL_Configuration();
00094   #endif
00095 
00096   #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00097   USBVRG_Configuration();                               /* Voltage of USB setting                           */
00098   #endif
00099 
00100   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00101      Must turn on if the USB clock source is from HSI (PLL clock Source)
00102   */
00103   #if 0
00104   { /* Turn on HSI auto trim function                                                                       */
00105     CKCU_HSIAutoTrimClkConfig(CKCU_ATC_USB);
00106     CKCU_HSIAutoTrimCmd(ENABLE);
00107   }
00108   #endif
00109 
00110   { /* USB Descriptor, Core, and Class initialization                                                       */
00111     gUSBCore.pDriver = (u32 *)&gUSBDriver;              /* Initiate memory pointer of USB driver            */
00112     gUSBCore.Power.CallBack_Suspend.func  = Suspend;    /* Install suspend call back function into USB core */
00113 
00114     USBDDesc_Init(&gUSBCore.Device.Desc);               /* Initiate memory pointer of descriptor            */
00115     USBDClass_Init(&gUSBCore.Class);                    /* Initiate USB Class layer                         */
00116     USBDCore_Init(&gUSBCore);                           /* Initiate USB Core layer                          */
00117   }
00118 
00119   NVIC_EnableIRQ(USB_IRQn);                             /* Enable USB device interrupt                      */
00120 }
00121 
00122 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00123 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00124  * @brief  Configure USB PLL
00125  * @retval None
00126  ************************************************************************************************************/
00127 void USBPLL_Configuration(void)
00128 {
00129   { /* USB PLL configuration                                                                                */
00130 
00131     /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00132        Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00133        Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00134     */
00135     CKCU_PLLInitTypeDef PLLInit;
00136 
00137     PLLInit.ClockSource = CKCU_PLLSRC_HSE;  // CKCU_PLLSRC_HSE or CKCU_PLLSRC_HSI
00138     #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL_96M)
00139     PLLInit.CFG = CKCU_USBPLL_8M_96M;
00140     #else
00141     PLLInit.CFG = CKCU_USBPLL_8M_48M;
00142     #endif
00143     PLLInit.BYPASSCmd = DISABLE;
00144     CKCU_USBPLLInit(&PLLInit);
00145   }
00146 
00147   CKCU_USBPLLCmd(ENABLE);
00148 
00149   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_USBPLLRDY) == RESET);
00150   CKCU_USBClockConfig(CKCU_CKUSBPLL);
00151 }
00152 #endif
00153 
00154 #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00155 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00156  * @brief  Configure USB Voltage
00157  * @retval None
00158  ************************************************************************************************************/
00159 void USBVRG_Configuration(void)
00160 {
00161   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00162   CKCUClock.Bit.BKP = 1;
00163   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00164 
00165   PWRCU_SetVREG(PWRCU_VREG_3V3);
00166 
00167   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00168      USB LDO should be enabled (PWRCU_VREG_ENABLE) if the MCU VDD > 3.6 V.
00169   */
00170   PWRCU_VREGConfig(PWRCU_VREG_BYPASS);
00171 }
00172 #endif
00173 
00174 #define REMOTE_WAKEUP      (0)
00175 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00176   * @brief  Suspend call back function which enter DeepSleep1
00177   * @param  uPara: Parameter for Call back function
00178   * @retval None
00179   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00180 void Suspend(u32 uPara)
00181 {
00182   #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00183   u32 IsRemoteWakeupAllowed;
00184   #endif
00185 
00186   if (gIsLowPowerAllowed)
00187   {
00188 
00189     #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00190     /* Disable EXTI interrupt to prevent interrupt occurred after wakeup                                    */
00191     EXTI_IntConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, DISABLE);
00192     IsRemoteWakeupAllowed = USBDCore_GetRemoteWakeUpFeature(&gUSBCore);
00193 
00194     if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE)
00195     {
00196       /* Enable EXTI wake event and clear wakeup flag                                                       */
00197       EXTI_WakeupEventConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, EXTI_WAKEUP_LOW_LEVEL, ENABLE);
00198       EXTI_ClearWakeupFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00199     }
00200     #endif
00201 
00202     __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld >DEEPSLEEP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00203 
00204     // Add your procedure here which disable related IO to reduce power consumption
00205     // ..................
00206     //
00207 
00208     if ((gUSBCore.Info.CurrentStatus == USB_STATE_SUSPENDED) && ((HT_USB->CSR & 0xC0) == 0x40))   // D+ = 1, D- = 0
00209     {
00210       /* For Bus powered device, you must enter DeepSleep1 when device has been suspended. For self-powered */
00211       /* device, you may decide to enter DeepSleep1 or not depended on your application.                    */
00212 
00213       /* For the convenient during debugging and evaluation stage, the USBDCore_LowPower() is map to a null */
00214       /* function by default. In the real product, you must map this function to the low power function of  */
00215       /* firmware library by setting USBDCORE_ENABLE_LOW_POWER as 1 (in the ht32fxxxx_usbdconf.h file).     */
00216       USBDCore_LowPower();
00217     }
00218 
00219     // Add your procedure here which recovery related IO for application
00220     // ..................
00221     //
00222 
00223     __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld <DEEPSLEEP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00224 
00225     #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00226     if (EXTI_GetWakeupFlagStatus(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL) == SET)
00227     {
00228       __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld WAKEUP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00229       if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE && USBDCore_IsSuspend(&gUSBCore) == TRUE)
00230       {
00231         USBDCore_TriggerRemoteWakeup();
00232       }
00233     }
00234 
00235     if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE)
00236     {
00237       /* Disable EXTI wake event and clear wakeup flag                                                      */
00238       EXTI_WakeupEventConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, EXTI_WAKEUP_LOW_LEVEL, DISABLE);
00239       EXTI_ClearWakeupFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00240     }
00241 
00242     /* Clear EXTI edge flag and enable EXTI interrupt                                                       */
00243     EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00244     EXTI_IntConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, ENABLE);
00245     #endif
00246   }
00247 
00248   return;
00249 }
00250 
00251 #if (HT32_LIB_DEBUG == 1)
00252 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00253   * @brief  Report both the error name of the source file and the source line number.
00254   * @param  filename: pointer to the source file name.
00255   * @param  uline: error line source number.
00256   * @retval None
00257   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00258 void assert_error(u8* filename, u32 uline)
00259 {
00260   /*
00261      This function is called by IP library that the invalid parameters has been passed to the library API.
00262      Debug message can be added here.
00263      Example: printf("Parameter Error: file %s on line %d\r\n", filename, uline);
00264   */
00265 
00266   while (1)
00267   {
00268   }
00269 }
00270 #endif
